intro: Crepidomanes rothertii, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Crepidomanes rothertii is often found in regions with well-drained soils and limited moisture.
